Author: emma#2653
Content: asset chains are great tech .. we need to actively find product market fit for it... Don't believe in "If you build they will come" ... need to talk to businesses/ enterprise and help them to utilise asset chains to bring efficiency in their business.. which either create new markets or help in cost saving .. In my view many cost saving use cases / proposals can help in market penetration .. as this will help in grow komodo ecosystem.. more use for the platform and more developers attracted to learn and build on komodo blockchain .. many platforms such as stellar and waves are partnering with enterprises .. komodo with current tech (some additional java script libraries to use like komodo.js to interact with asset chains)   is enough for business use case ..

Author: emma#2653
Content: In my view, we should put efforts on making komodo more robust and stable (1st priority for business which create trust) .. and increase adaptability..this will also help in deciding what kind of features we should prioritises on platform ...

Author: CMaurice#1685
Content:
Soooo. I'd like to see blockchain enabling a mesh of collateral, facilitating trade finance, a bit like a representation of the Turkish post-dated cheques system.

I'm not sure yet what it would look like in a practical sense, but I have several ideas informed by a long interest in the subject.

This seems possible to me in the light of the extraordinary changes in distribution over the last ten years, at least here where fully half the economy seems to be delivering very small boxes to small boxes in the sky.

Where we'll eventually get to: barter, crowd funding, import/export, eBay, Amazon.

So need to choose a small and achievable use-case, like a vanilla farmer exporting to a London ice cream makers, a Macedonian hand-huller providing sun dried apricot kernels to me, a small-run FPGA designer in Cambridge wanting funding for a new device. I'd also like some un-roasted coffee beans (import tax and duty free here) and organic cashew supplies, please.

Something that uses several techniques like escrow (obviously for crowd supply, but also export), multi-sig (perhaps a release of a proportion of funds on OK from agreed 3rd party quality control in importing country). These are just example ideas.

Author: CMaurice#1685
Content: iuno, just some starter ideas, ama

Author: CMaurice#1685
Content: in a way, it's sort of how I got here, looking for the tools.  I wasn't satisfied with where ETH was going, I came across Paul Sztorc's 'bit assets' and kept going  until I found the CC stuff here

Author: CrisF#3405

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: That is what I've found so attractive here.  The realistic potential to empower people like me, with little knowledge and experience in tech.  And finding the people who can make that happen.

Content: the bitcoin wallet implementation built into the daemon is fucking shite ... and if ther is like 100k utxo it prety much stops working

Content: Notary nodes make loads of txs.. .

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: currently the only way to "fix" it is ot send the whole balance ot youself every few weeks and then import he private key with a rescan of only a few blocks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: needless downtime

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: nearly have a new solution working, where once all the utxo are spent, the old txs are removed automatically

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you only need to know whats avalible to be spent, dont need to save te GB's of sent txs, as every time you try to send a tx, it ahs to load all these old ones and sort them, slowing it down to a crawl .

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I sorted the issues I was facing... I think that if someone uses the notary wallet to make a lot of normal transactions, it could run into issues... and in that case they would need to carry out a normal wallet reset ... to fix things, before  the walelt auto clean would be able to work... There is also another option I may add to it, where you smply give it a txid and have it remove all TX's that are not that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This allows you to preform a normal wallet reset, ie. send all your funds to yourself... then just call the funciton to remove every tx that is not this transaction.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
The normal mode is quite complicated in the end, but a call of it will:
1) scan the wallet for transactions where all the vouts that are yours are spent
2) scan the wallet for all transactions to the CRYPTO address (notarisations) 
3) cross check all notarisations to transactions that are totally spent
4) remove all notarisations that came from the totally spent transations
5) remove the totally spent transactions

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think a call of this funciton every 500 blocks, would keep the wallet a very small size.

Content: Great work!
